title: Print, Design for Panels with Tempietto with Minerva, Crowned by an Obelisk and Victory, 1745
title_raw: Design for Panels with Tempietto with Minerva, Crowned by an Obelisk and Victory
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed: On plate, upper center 3me. Livre; upper right: C; upper center, in the image, in a cartouche, Livre de Paneaux a divers usages,/Inventé par François de Cuvilliés Conseiller,/et Architecte de Sa Majesté Imperialle./se vend chez Lauteur.; lower center, in the image: Se vend aussi a Paris chez le Sr. Poilly ruë St. Iacque a limage St. Benoit Avec Privilege du Roy.; lower left: Inventé par F. de Cuvilliés; lower center: C.P.S.C.M.; lower right: gravé par C.A. de Lespilliez/1
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 79, 80, and 81)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Each plate of the series has two vertical panels with modern grotesques, the basic structure composed of rocailles, upper center a compartment with a scene. On the tempietto the coat of arms of the Emperor.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, Design for Panels with Tempietto with Minerva, Crowned by an Obelisk and Victory, 1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. 
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-14
